uk.co.visalia.brightpearl.apiclient.http.httpclient4

Class HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.visalia.brightpearl.apiclient.http.httpclient4.HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder

  • public final class HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder
extends Object

    Constructs a configured HttpClient4ClientFactory. Supports construction in code using the builder pattern (starting with httpClient4ClientFactory()) and usage as a Spring bean factory. For example: 

     <bean id="httpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder" class="HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder">
     <property name="maxConnections">20</property>
 </bean>

 <bean id="httpClient4ClientFactory"
     factory-bean="httpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder"
     factory-method="build"/>

    See static fields of HttpClient4ClientFactory for the default settings applied if methods in this builder are not used to override them.

    • Method Detail

      • httpClient4ClientFactory

        public static HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder httpClient4ClientFactory()
        Static builder method for method chaining, fluent builder style.
        Returns:
        a new HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder instance.

      • setMaxConnections

        public void setMaxConnections(int maxConnections)
        Set the maximum total connections allowed across all routes. If creating a client for use with multiple Brightpearl customer accounts there will be one route per datacenter.
        Parameters:
        maxConnections - maximum total connections allowed for all routes.

      • setMaxConnectionsPerRoute

        public void setMaxConnectionsPerRoute(int maxConnectionsPerRoute)
        Set the maximum connections allowed per route. All Brightpearl customer accounts on a datacenter will share the same route, so this is not a per-account limit.
        Parameters:
        maxConnectionsPerRoute - maximum connections allowed per route.

      • setConnectionManagerTimeoutMs

        public void setConnectionManagerTimeoutMs(int connectionManagerTimeoutMs)
        Sets the connection manager timeout in milliseconds. This is the time a thread will wait for a connection to become free when the connection pool is exhausted. Use zero for indefinite blocking.
        Parameters:
        connectionManagerTimeoutMs - connection manager timeout in milliseconds.

      • setConnectionTimeoutMs

        public void setConnectionTimeoutMs(int connectionTimeoutMs)
        Set the time in milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established before aborting the request. A value of zero is interpreted as infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        connectionTimeoutMs - connection timeout in milliseconds.

      • setSocketTimeoutMs

        public void setSocketTimeoutMs(int socketTimeoutMs)
        Maximum time of inactivity to allow between two consecutive data packets from the server before aborting the request. A value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        socketTimeoutMs - socket timeout in milliseconds.

      • setAllowRedirects

        public void setAllowRedirects(boolean allowRedirects)
        Set whether redirects should be followed. Redirects are not expected from the Brightpearl API according to the documentation provided, and this setting is untested.
        Parameters:
        allowRedirects - whether redirects should be followed.

      • withMaxConnections

        public HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder withMaxConnections(int maxConnections)
        Set the maximum total connections allowed across all routes. If creating a client for use with multiple Brightpearl customer accounts there will be one route per datacenter.
        Parameters:
        maxConnections - maximum total connections allowed for all routes.
        Returns:
        builder instance for method chaining.

      • withMaxConnectionsPerRoute

        public HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder withMaxConnectionsPerRoute(int maxConnectionsPerRoute)
        Set the maximum connections allowed per route. All Brightpearl customer accounts on a datacenter will share the same route, so this is not a per-account limit.
        Parameters:
        maxConnectionsPerRoute - maximum connections allowed per route.
        Returns:
        builder instance for method chaining.

      • withConnectionManagerTimeoutMs

        Parameters:
        connectionManagerTimeoutMs - connection manager timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        builder instance for method chaining.

      • withConnectionTimeoutMs

        public HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder withConnectionTimeoutMs(int connectionTimeoutMs)

        Parameters:
        connectionTimeoutMs - connection timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        builder instance for method chaining.

      • withSocketTimeoutMs

        public HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder withSocketTimeoutMs(int socketTimeoutMs)

        Parameters:
        socketTimeoutMs - socket timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        builder instance for method chaining.

      • withAllowRedirects

        public HttpClient4ClientFactoryBuilder withAllowRedirects(boolean allowRedirects)
        Set whether redirects should be followed. Redirects are not expected from the Brightpearl API according to the documentation provided, and this setting is untested.
        Parameters:
        allowRedirects - whether redirects should be followed.

        builder instance for method chaining.
